alert.note: Alert for Pulaski; Wayne (Kentucky) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Special Weather Statement issued April 06 at 5:06PM EDT by NWS Jackson
info.description: ...A strong thunderstorm will impact portions of northern Wayne and central Pulaski Counties through 545 PM EDT... At 505 PM EDT, Doppler radar was tracking a strong thunderstorm near Parnell, or 7 miles northwest of Monticello, moving northeast at 45 mph. HAZARD...Winds in excess of 40 mph and half inch hail. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Gusty winds could knock down tree limbs and blow around unsecured objects. Minor damage to outdoor objects is possible. This strong thunderstorm will be near... Steubenville around 510 PM EDT. Naomi, Mill Springs, Faubush and Betsey around 515 PM EDT. Nancy and Frazer around 520 PM EDT. Pulaski County Park, Bronston, General Burnside S.P. and Quinton around 525 PM EDT. Other locations in the path of this storm include Somerset, Burnside, Somerset Pulaski Airport, Elihu, Tateville, Science Hill, Ruth, Grade, Dabney, Dykes and Bobtown. MAX HAIL SIZE...0.50 IN MAX WIND GUST...40 MPH
info.instruction: If outdoors, consider seeking shelter inside a building.
